description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the elevation of privilege vulnerability in the Windows Ancillary Function Driver for Winsock (CVE-2024-38141):

1. Identify your Windows version and architecture (x64 or 32-bit).
2. Download the appropriate KB update from the Microsoft Update Catalog links below.
3. Install the KB updates to ensure your system is patched against this vulnerability.
4. Restart your system after installation to apply the changes.

**Details**:
This security update addresses a use after free vulnerability that could allow an attacker to elevate privileges in the context of the current user. The maximum severity of this vulnerability is classified as important. For detailed information, refer to the KB articles related to your specific build of Windows.

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure that you are on a supported version of Windows.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation. 

Available Updates:
- Windows 11 Version 24H2 for x64-based Systems: [KB5041571](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041592)
- Windows 11 Version 23H2 for x64-based Systems: [KB5041585](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041585)
- Windows 11 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems: [KB5041580](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041580)
- Windows 10 Version 21H2 for x64-based Systems: [KB5041592](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041592)
- Windows 10 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems: [KB5041782](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041782).
